# Overview

Clinical trials progress through a series of phases to evaluate safety and dose finding (Phase I), preliminary efficacy and further safety profiling (Phase II), and confirmatory efficacy and safety profiling (Phase III). Often we have periods of whitespace between these studies as we wrap one study up and plan for the next. In this module we introduce the concept of seamless designs, where we intentionally write a single study protocol to span multiple stages to reduce the time to evaluate the phases of research.

# Code Examples in R

The one R package that comes up for seamless designs is:

* [`asd`](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/asd/): runs simulations for adaptive seamless designs with and without early outcomes for treatment selection and subpopulation type designs
